result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony O Poorman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony O Poorman in court with attorney Thomas R. Jones.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for competency hearing. No challenges to the report from Dr. Collins by the State,  defense or defendant, the Court finds that the defendant is incompetent. Discussion had on the record. State moves to permanently suspended court proceedings pursuant to Wisc. Stat. section(s) 971.14(6)(a).  Court orders proceedings permanently suspended pursuant to  Wisc. Stat. section(s) 971.14(6)(a).
Bail motion by defense to dismiss case argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Anthony O Poorman in court with attorney Thomas R. Jones.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for return on doctors report.  Defense does not dispute the findings, however the state contests the report. Case adjourned for competency hearing.  Competency hearing scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
-Received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
copy of letter from Atty. T. Jones to Dr. Deborah Collins, dated July 25, 2016 - received and filed.
Court withdraws STAYED bench warrant.  Warrant was NOT forwarded to the Sheriff's Dept.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony O Poorman in court with Attorney Thomas R. Jones.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties review doctor's report.
Doctor is unable to offer opinion at this time and requests additional time to review additonal records.

Court finds that defendant is not competent to proceed at this time; Court is unable to determine if defendant will regain competency during the time limits.  Proceedings remain suspended.
Court orders case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Branch 28.  Order for Competency Examination - signed by the Court and filed.

All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Branch 37,  in Room 313 of the Safety Bldg.
Clerk:  jms
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

from Deborah L. Collins, Psy.D., ABPP dated June 21, 2016 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Thomas R. Jones in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel places on the record defendant's current health condition.
Doctor's report received however case must be rescheduled to review report with the defendant.
Court orders case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Branch 28.

Defendant not present in court, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until July 20, 2016
Clerk:  jms

Scheduled initial court date with Judge Conen in Branch 30 but defendant has CO-Defendant cases 15CF1685 and 15CF1686 which are heard by Judge Sanders in Branch 28.
Case reassigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. 
Court date calendared for 06-23-2016 at 8:30AM in Branch 28 Judge Sanders.

Court ordered no possession of ANY dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
**Due to Defendant's situation he has not yet been booked in the Milwaukee County Jail and will need a DNA sample taken at that time*
Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

Defendant Anthony O Poorman in court with attorney Thomas R. Jones.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  
Order for Examination, signed and filed.   
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Conen, Branch 30.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Letters on behalf of the defendant from Columbia St. Mary's; received and filed.
